intro: Tephrosia heckmanniana, commonly known as the Mexican blue bean, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are usually blue or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The seeds are enclosed in a pod and are used in traditional medicine and as a source of protein in some regions.
